Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2011 07:35AM FrancaB wrote: I have been reading your post on a morning after I sent my daughter off with friends for a day of fun and I was feeling sorry for myself because I was not the one that could do that with her.  But in reading everything in your post today has put things in perspective for me.  So many inspirational people on this board.  Waterlily you are the most inspirational of all.  Please know that I will send all good intentions your way and hope that the God you so fervently believe in takes really good care of you no matter what happens.  You are an amazing soul and I hope your suffering will be alleviated and that all treatments will be successful. I lost a son when I was younger he was five years old.  But you know from his existences so many amazing things happened - so in his brief 5 years of life in his own way he accomplished so much.  My point is that you are already accomplishing so much in this terrible journey, you are inspirational to all of us here and hope that you realize how meaningful your life is and will continue to be.   With your courage you have already accomplished so much.  If we help you in some small way - you are also helping us.  I send you a big hug that would take your breath away if I could do it in person.   Franca
Posts.Title: 28 YR Old Is Looking For Support from You wwaterlilyy ibcmets

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2011 06:47PM FrancaB wrote: Hi I can imagine how difficult the decision was.  I completely understand, I am almost there myself.    Trying one new concoction and then I've told my oncologist we should have a serious conversation 'cause there is no more quality of life on chemo, I've been battling hard for six years and now I'm really tired.  I hope with all my heart that you will get many and many months of quality life to enjoy with your family.  Franca
